basics.name: Jeffrey Smith
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A current data science and statistics student. Fields of interest include the natural sciences, probability, and biostatistics.

work.name: Mathematics Department, Western Washington University
work.summary: Performed statistical analysis on long run data of ice coverage duration on a subset of lakes in the Northern Hemisphere.

work.name: Tutoring Center, Western Washington University
work.summary: Tutored undergraduate students in statistics, math, and chemistry. Led study groups to help Honors General Chemistry students prepare for their exams.

work.name: Chemistry Department, Western Washington University
work.summary: Researched ligand chemistry with purpose of reducing nitroxides to less harmful nitrogen species.

awards.title: NASA Space Grant Summer Research
awards.summary: To enhance higher education opportunities for students seeking to pursue careers in the fields of science, technology, engineering and math (STEM), and to provide public outreach for NASA missions, and thereby strengthen the future workforce for NASA and our nation.

references.name: Professor Kimihiro Noguchi
references.reference: Professor of Statistics at Western Washington University. Email: noguchk@wwu.edu

references.name: Professor Heather Kitada Smalley
references.reference: Professor of Statistics and Data Science at Willamette University. Email: hsmalley@willamette.edu

projects.name: Applying SSA to Lake Ice Phenology
projects.summary: Utilizing singular spectrum analysis (SSA) to analyze trends in the ice phenology of lakes in the Northern Hemisphere.

projects.name: Effect of Shipping Lanes on Ocean Health
projects.summary: Study on the correlation between shipping lanes, nitrate levels, plankton levels, and whale activity.
